channel.title: [Apollo] ProtoScape [Apollo]
channel.description:
[center][img]http://s1.postimage.org/c7un7nurd/Proto_Scape_Banner_NOCREDS.png[/img][/center]
[size=16pt][b]Supporters:[/b][/size]
[ul][li](N)eon[/li] [li]`SJ_[/li] [li]Ix Soulcist xI[/li] [li]Wet Dreamss[/li] [li]lostmyphat[/li] [li]AtomicInt_[/li] [li]imsuperman05[/li] [li]sinisoul[/li] [li]youridudock[/li] [li]Team_Rocket[/li] [li]ox random xi[/li][/ul]
[center] [i]Looking for someone who is trustworthy, is proficient at programming in Java (can do simple things needed for content, like iterating through an array and constructing enums.), and dependable.The server base is Apollo. It is quite exceptional and is extremely easy to change revisions. I hope that when I get this server done and I am done with hosting it for a while, that this release will end all 317's loading ###. Albeit, mine is a 317 loading a 377 cache, but nobody really has a 317 cache. :P There is script support for Ruby, and I will most likely implement this script support more into the server after everything is said and done so people can do what Graham imagined; Download scripts from a repository and install into the server. [/i]
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,526031.msg3830883.html#msg3830883]More info on Apollo.[/url]
[i]The server started with mining, and was completely scripted in Ruby. Everything else you see is a product of me.
The sharing of the files will be done via dropbox, of course. :P
[size=18pt][u][b]Media:[/b][/u][/size] [url=http://img64.imageshack.us/img64/7052/herbclean.jpg]Herb Cleaning[/url] [url=http://img804.imageshack.us/img804/4607/bonesw.jpg]Burying Bones[/url] [url=http://img545.imageshack.us/img545/1470/unfpotion.jpg]Unfinished Potions[/url] [url=http://img220.imageshack.us/img220/112/potion.jpg]Finished Potions[/url] [url=http://img10.imageshack.us/img10/144/cookingqk.jpg]Cooking Meats[/url] [url=http://img683.imageshack.us/img683/2580/thieving.jpg]Pickpocketing[/url] [url=http://img829.imageshack.us/img829/2523/combinations.jpg]Combination RuneCrafting[/url] [url=http://img231.imageshack.us/img231/1083/stooores.jpg]Stores[/url] [url=http://img339.imageshack.us/img339/5825/leathercrafting.jpg]Leather Crafting[/url] [url=http://img824.imageshack.us/img824/3043/potions.jpg]Potions[/url]
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5p7pRriwQPY
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hh7TGHHWJiQ
I've been working on this since August, although I have had a lot on my plate until recently. I would really like to get this development off of the ground and to be hosted by the end of January. I have great expectations for the server.
Format. If you feel you have a better one, then just use that one. [code] How old are you? E-mail address (for dropbox): Contact info (msn, skype, w/e you want, you can pm if you don't want it to be public): How long have you been programming? Time zone you are in: Examples of code you have written: [/code]
I may come up with a questionnaire to see how good you are if need be... Only looking for one person.

item.title: [Apollo] ProtoScape [Apollo]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

WW:

I just find it a shame that you don’t develop your content as ruby plug-ins. Thats unfortunately where I’ve lost interest, however I can wish you good luck on your project.

I will convert them later on in development so when I release it people can remove/modify content easily. I just find it easier to develop in Java atm. Also, Ares_ loves adding content in the form of Ruby plug-ins. Everything he has written so far has been a ruby plug-in. Why do you find it such of a shame?

Team_Rocket:

What’s Ares_ going to do with his Hyperion?

Not 100% sure, although I think he might of stopped developing on it/lost interest. I’ll ask him for you.

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:27, topic:427133”]I support.
good luck, hope you actually finish an apollo project
its complicated but i believe in you[/quote]Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: [Apollo] ProtoScape [Apollo]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Don’t have to be too great. Just have to be able to code skill related content and have potential to help me with core related stuff. I can manage the core stuff for now. Also being able to write plugins would be nice too as it is extremely easy to write plugins and install them.

Edit: If anyone is thinking about applying, but isn’t sure of how good of a programmer I am you can assess my programming skills by downloading this https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,529047.0.html

Of course disregard any code that doesn’t have @author The Wanderer in the top of the class. You can see what I wrote in my development thread.

Please welcome Ares_ to the team.

Read full topic
